column4: Noob here.  I just switched from ubuntu 10.10 to 11.04.  My Intel integrated graphics card does not support Unity so it defaulted to Classic Gnome.  I need the "zoom desktop" feature to work as I am legally blind.  This worked in 10.10, but cannot get it to work in 11.04.  Any suggestions to get it working again? Thanks in advance.
is that "zoom desktop" a compiz feature?  if so, you might have an issue...
then unity3d's failure to run indicates a compiz failure to run.
does dmesg register anything (says if the kernel sees something)
uhh is there any way to narrow down what I'm look for with "dmesg"?  What am I looking for?
unplug the device, wait - type "dmesg" -- plug device in, wait -- type "dmesg" (is there any change?)
something like "dmesg | tail -n 15" might help also
Yes, the last command was easier to notice if kernel noticed the phone, and it does when I plug it in.
does it get an sdX assigned to it?
that would have been mentioned in teh dmesg output
This is the line it shows  [ 2541.788043] usb 1-6: new high speed USB device using ehci_hcd and address 7
That is what it shows after I use the second command.  dmesg | tail -n 15
I use my phone sometimes to tether my internet connection using "easytether" and it works.  It just won't recognize it as a drive
it doesn't seem the kernel sees it as a "drive" :(  what ubuntu version are you using again?
sorry, i'm sorta outta "real" suggestions...  good luck
Hey, thanks for the help.  Any other place you could direct me for help?
